page.title: 09History of Education
page.content: {Education}in Bentley took place in the village{school}which was built in 1882. Fifty years ago children started school at 5 and left at 14.The majority of children took no {examinations.}It was customary to walk to school. There were no school dinners but free milk was issued every day. Few children had{holidays} as the majority helped with the farming. It was not unusual for boys to truant on market days or to harrow behind the plough instead of attending school. The school closed in 1962 .The village children now attend Tardebigge First school and the Ridgeway Middle school, Astwood Bank.
